intro: Dupatya eriophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf or woollyleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique texture and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
